title.rendered: Injured Son Heung-min will play for South Korea in the Qatar World cup

content.rendered:
Son Heung-min has become named to South Korea`s squad on Saturday for the Qatar World Cup. However, it remains to be seen if he`ll be to be had to play after an intense facial injury. South Korea’s captain and talisman suffered a fracture around his left eye at some unspecified time in the future in the course of a Champions League healthy for Tottenham and then had surgery final week.

South Korea’s Portuguese instructor Paulo Bento as he called his team said,

We are in touch with him and Tottenham’s medical division

“About the proper day he can educate with the organization, we do now no longer have that information,” he said.

“We need to wait; we need to have a look at each day his situation.

“We have enough time to decide. The most important (issue is that), he recovers similarly to possibly, he feels comfortable, and then we will take the final decision.”

Bento named the twenty-7th player, beforehand of Oh Hyeon-Gyu, who will educate with the organization in Qatar. And he’ll replace the reputation of Son if he does now no longer make it.

South Korea’s starting healthy is in competition with Uruguay on November 24. Son, who has scored 35 desires in 106 global appearances, wrote on social media this week: “I can’t wait to represent our lovely country, see you soon”.

A South Korean organization missing Son and distinctive Europe-based totally game enthusiasts beat Iceland 1-0 in a home first-class on Friday.

South Korea moreover performs Ghana and Portugal in Group H.

Team of South Korea:

Defenders: Kwon Kyung-won (Gamba Osaka/JPN), Kim Moon-Hwan (Jeon Buk Motors), Kim Min-Jae (Napoli/ITA) Kim Young-Gwon (Ulsan), Kim Jin-Su (Jeon Buk Motors), Kim Tae-Hwan (Ulsan), Yoon Jong-Gyu (FC Seoul), Cho Yu-min (Daejeon Hana Citizen), Hong Chul (Daegu FC)

Midfielders: Kwon Chang-hoon (Gimcheon Sangmu), Na Sang-ho (FC Seoul), Paik Seung-ho (Jeon Buk Motors), Lee Kang-in (Real Mallorca/ESP), Lee Jae-sung (Mainz/GER), Jeon Woo-Yeong (Freiburg/GER), Hwang In-beam (Olympiakos/GRE), Hwang Hee-chan (Wolverhampton Wanderers/ENG), Song Min-kyu (Jeon Buk Motors), Son Jun-ho (Shandong Taishan/CHN), Na Sang-ho (FC Seoul)

Forwards: Son Heung-min (Tottenham Hotspur/ENG), Cho Gue-sung (Jeon Buk Motors), Hwang Ui-jo (Olympiakos/GRE)

Goalkeepers: Kim Seung-Gyu (Al-Shabab/KSA), Song Bum-Keun (Jeon Buk Motors), Jo Hyeon-woo (Ulsan)

Read more: Match officials for T20 World Cup 2022 final announced
